title.narrative: 1.1 EVIDENCE BASED PLANNING AND MONITORING

description.narrative: 1.1 Ministry of Health and Sanitation has increased capacity for evidence-based planning, budgeting, and monitoring for equitable maternal, neonatal, child and adolescent health and nutrition (MNCAH+N) services., which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children (aged 0â€“18) and women benefit from quality comprehensive health and nutrition services and practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.1 Ministry of Health and Sanitation has increased capacity for evidence-based planning, budgeting, and monitoring for equitablematernal, neonatal, child and adolescent health and nutrition (MNCAH+N) services.

description.narrative: After a decade of advocacy, the Regulation of Breastmilk Substitutes bill was enacted following parliamentary approval. For the first time, the Government allocated a budget for procurement of ready-to-use therapeutic food in 2022, a step towards sustainable nutrition financing. In support of implementing the Universal Health Coverage roadmap, a community-based primary health care model was developed and piloted, using the 7step evidence-based planning and appreciative inquiry approaches. Major improvement was made in data management for decision making at the tertiary children’s hospital. National Nutrition Survey was conducted to inform humanitarian and developmental actions in COVID-19 context and adolescent nutrition programming.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
